cufy.util

Class Reflection

  • java.lang.Object
    • cufy.util.Reflection

  • public final class Reflection
extends java.lang.Object
    Utils for dealing with java reflection.
    Since:
    11-Jun-2019
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    lsafer

      • asArrayClass

        public static <C> java.lang.Class<C[]> asArrayClass(java.lang.Class<C> klass)
        Get an array class of the given class.
        Type Parameters:
        C - the targeted class
        Parameters:
        klass - to get an array class of
        Returns:
        an array class of the given class
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given class is null

      • asObjectClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> asObjectClass(java.lang.Class<?> klass)
        Get the class that extends Object that represent the given class.
        Parameters:
        klass - to get the object class of
        Returns:
        the class that extends Object class and represent the given class
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given class is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given class neither object nor primitive

      • asPrimitiveClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> asPrimitiveClass(java.lang.Class<?> klass)
        Get the class that don't extends Object from the given class.
        Parameters:
        klass - to get the non-object class of
        Returns:
        the non-object class of the given class
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the given class don't have a primitive type
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given class is null

      • getAllFields

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> getAllFields(java.lang.Class<?> klass)
        Get ALL the fields that the given class have. ALL means ALL.
        Parameters:
        klass - the class to get all the fields that it have
        Returns:
        ALL the fields that the given class have
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given class is null

      • getAllMethods

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Method> getAllMethods(java.lang.Class<?> klass)
        Get all methods that can be invoked to the given class. Overriding methods will cancel the Overridden methods. No duplicated methods will be returned.
        Parameters:
        klass - the class to get the methods from
        Returns:
        the list of all methods that can be invoked to the given class. (no overridden methods)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given class is null

      • ignite

        public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> T ignite(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
                                                throws T extends java.lang.Throwable
        A java syntax glitch to throw any throwable without the need to catch it.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the throwable to trick the compiler that it's the one thrown
        Parameters:
        throwable - to be ignite
        Returns:
        nothing
        Throws:
        T - exactly the given throwable (unless if the given throwable is null. Then NullPointerException will be thrown)
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given throwable is null
        T extends java.lang.Throwable

      • overrides

        public static boolean overrides(java.lang.reflect.Method base,
                                java.lang.reflect.Method override)
        Check if the given 'override' method do override the 'base' method or not.
        Parameters:
        base - the method that expected to be overridden
        override - the method that expected to be overriding the base method
        Returns:
        true if the given 'override' method do override the 'base' method or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'base' or 'override' is null

      • primitiveCast

        public static java.lang.Object primitiveCast(java.lang.Class<?> klass,
                                             java.lang.Object value)
        Cast the given value to the given class. If the given class is primitive. And the given value's class can be casted to that primitive class. Then the cast will be preformed. Otherwise a ClassCastException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        klass - the class to cast the given value to
        value - the value to be casted to the given class
        Returns:
        the given value casted to the given class. Or null if the given value is null and the given class isn't primitive
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'klass' is null. Or if the given class is primitive and the given value is null
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the given value can't be casted to the given class
